pr_title: fix: remove dead code, enable re-applying of the stored procedure, remove unused key from stored procedure

timeline.message:
fix: remove dead code, enable re-applying of the stored procedure, remove unused key from stored procedure

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

ci: references to invalid versions which suffer env/path flaws that are going to be deprecated, and fixes the tx reference

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

ci: hardcode the jdk

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

timeline.body: does this comment invalidate the comment on the previous line?
timeline.bodyText: does this comment invalidate the comment on the previous line?
timeline.bodyHTML: does this comment invalidate the comment on the previous line?

timeline.body: I think its fine, but where were we starting the transaction before?
timeline.bodyText: I think its fine, but where were we starting the transaction before?
timeline.bodyHTML: I think its fine, but where were we starting the transaction before?
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: We were not starting a transaction before, we were using a statement which autocommitted the change.
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: ah, ok.  i remember trying something like this in the past and getting into trouble with the migration code...but I think that was before robin cleaned up all the transaction handling.  tests are passing, so i'm good if @punktilious is
replies.author: lmsurpre
